dcmst_construction_algorithms.genetic_algorithm module¶

dcmst_construction_algorithms.genetic_algorithm.check_degree(tree_encoding: numpy.ndarray, constraints: numpy.ndarray, num_sat: int) → bool[source]¶

Checks that all nodes within tree (encoded as a Prufer number) meet degree constraints. The degree of each node in the tree is 1 more than the number of times it appears in the Prufer number encoding. :param tree_encoding: a Prufer number (encoding) of a tree :param constraints: list that describes the maximum number of ISLs each satellite can establish at a given

point in time

Parameters

num_sat – the number of satellites within the network

Returns

determines if all degree constraints on vertices are met

dcmst_construction_algorithms.genetic_algorithm.fitness(chromosome: numpy.ndarray, cost_matrix: numpy.ndarray) → float[source]¶

Calculates the total sum cost of all edges in a given degree-constrained minimum spanning tree. :param chromosome: a list of possible solutions or “genes” to the DCMST problem :param cost_matrix: an adjacency matrix, such that element cost_matrix[i][j] represents the cost of the graph edge

ij

Returns

the fitness/suitability of each solution or “gene” within the chromosome, as determined by the total sum cost of all edges within the tree (aim to minimise)

dcmst_construction_algorithms.genetic_algorithm.genetic_algorithm(cost_matrix: numpy.ndarray, constraints: numpy.ndarray, num_sat: int, population_size=20)[source]¶

Returns a degree-constrained minimum spanning tree of the network built using a genetic algorithm presented in ‘Comparison of Algorithms for the Degree Constrained Minimum Spanning Tree’. https://doi.org/10.1023/A:1011977126230 :param cost_matrix: an adjacency matrix, such that element cost_matrix[i][j] represents the cost of the graph edge

ij

Parameters

  • constraints – list that describes the maximum number of ISLs each satellite can establish at a given point in time

  • num_sat – the number of satellites within the network

  • population_size – number of solutions generated each iteration of the algorithm

Returns

a DCMST and the degree of each vertex within the tree

dcmst_construction_algorithms.genetic_algorithm.prufer_decode(prufer_number: numpy.ndarray) → tuple[numpy.ndarray, numpy.ndarray][source]¶

Decodes Prufer number and returns tree encoded in Prufer number as adjacency matrix, as well as the degree of each node in the resulting tree. :param prufer_number: a Prufer number (encoding) of a tree :return: an adjacency matrix representing a spanning tree of the graph, as well as the degree of each vertex within

the tree

dcmst_construction_algorithms.genetic_algorithm.prufer_encode(tree: numpy.ndarray) → numpy.ndarray[source]¶

Encodes tree as its Prufer Number - uses Cayley’s representation (see DCMST comparison paper). :param tree: adjacency matrix representing a spanning tree of the graph :return: a Prufer number (encoding) of the given tree

dcmst_construction_algorithms.genetic_algorithm.random_trees(num_sat: int, constraints: numpy.ndarray, pop_size: int) → list[source]¶

Randomly generates a set number (indicated by population size) of valid degree-constrained spanning trees of satellite network. :param num_sat: the number of satellites within the network :param constraints: list that describes the maximum number of ISLs each satellite can establish at a given

point in time

Parameters

pop_size – number of solutions generated each iteration of the algorithm

Returns

list of randomly generated degree constrained minimum spanning trees (encoded as prufer numbers)
